poem:
A Threat in Rutherford County

Among the aftermath of Helene's breath,  
a shadow brews where aid should mend.  
Men come to heal with hands outstretched,  
yet one, Jacob, arms himself against  
their gentle craft—peace disrupted,  
troubled whispers in the Southern wind.  
Here, in this small rupture,  
hope and fear silently contend.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Man arrested over alleged violent threat against Fema staff in North Carolina A man accused of threatening violence against Federal Emergency Management Agency (Fema) workers responding to Hurricane Helene in North Carolina has been arrested, according to authorities. William Jacob Parsons, 44, faces a charge of “going armed to the terror of the public” after his arrest in Rutherford county, the local sheriff’s office said in a news release on Monday. The law enforcement agency". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Man arrested over alleged violent threat against Fema staff in North Carolina A man accused of threatening violence against Federal Emergency Management Agency (Fema) workers responding to Hurricane Helene in North Carolina has been arrested, according to authorities. William Jacob Parsons, 44, faces a charge of “going armed to the terror of the public” after his arrest in Rutherford county, the local sheriff’s office said in a news release on Monday.
